intro: Phyllanthus lindbergii, commonly known as Lindberg's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or perennial herb. Its unique morphology and adaptability to harsh conditions make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
